pullRequest.body:
Define `EuclideanGeometry.Sphere.IsDiameter`, the property of two
points being the endpoints of a diameter of a sphere, and
`EuclideanGeometry.Sphere.ofDiameter`, to construct the sphere on a
given diameter, and set up some basic API for these definitions.

This enables stating and proving geometrical results involving
diameters (as shown in the API setup here, there are several different
equivalent characterizations of a diameter, so justifying having a
common definition and API showing the different characterizations are
equivalent).  In particular, having the definition prepares the way
for stating and proving Thales's theorem, an easy entry on the
1000-plus list we're currently missing.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [ ] depends on: #21618

### PR summary [14c95690f2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21622/commits/14c95690f2b2cb66cfd807fa7aba50de595ad659)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsDiameter`
`+ IsDiameter.affine_pointReflection_center_left`
`+ IsDiameter.affine_pointReflection_center_right`
`+ IsDiameter.dist_left_right`
`+ IsDiameter.dist_left_right_div_two`
`+ IsDiameter.left_eq_of_isDiameter`
`+ IsDiameter.left_eq_right_iff`
`+ IsDiameter.left_ne_right_iff_radius_ne_zero`
`+ IsDiameter.left_ne_right_iff_radius_pos`
`+ IsDiameter.ofDiameter_eq`
`+ IsDiameter.pointReflection_center_left`
`+ IsDiameter.pointReflection_center_right`
`+ IsDiameter.right_eq_of_isDiameter`
`+ IsDiameter.right_mem`
`+ IsDiameter.sbtw`
`+ IsDiameter.symm`
`+ IsDiameter.wbtw`
`+ Sphere.radius_nonneg_of_mem`
`+ isDiameter_comm`
`+ isDiameter_iff_left_mem_and_affine_pointReflection_center_left`
`+ isDiameter_iff_left_mem_and_midpoint_eq_center`
`+ isDiameter_iff_left_mem_and_pointReflection_center_left`
`+ isDiameter_iff_mem_and_mem_and_dist`
`+ isDiameter_iff_mem_and_mem_and_wbtw`
`+ isDiameter_iff_ofDiameter_eq`
`+ isDiameter_iff_right_mem_and_affine_pointReflection_center_right`
`+ isDiameter_iff_right_mem_and_midpoint_eq_center`
`+ isDiameter_iff_right_mem_and_pointReflection_center_right`
`+ isDiameter_ofDiameter`
`+ ofDiameter`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21617~~
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21618~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

What's the reason for including both `left_ne_right_iff_radius_ne_zero` and `left_ne_right_iff_radius_pos `? Conversely `IsDiameter.sbtw` just uses the `pos` variant.

And I think there should also be more a more general version: if a sphere contains any two distinct points, then the radius is positive.

pullRequest.title: feat(Geometry/Euclidean/Sphere/Basic): diameters
